meanings.definition: The quality or state of being precocious.
meanings.sent1: Her precocity in reading amazed her parents.
meanings.sent2: His precocity in music was evident from a young age.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's precocity in solving puzzles made her the family champion.
meanings.sent4: The precocity of the young artist's talent was compared to that of a seasoned professional.
meanings.sent5: The precocity of the plant's growth was a marvel to the gardener.

meanings.sent1: The precocity of the child's speech development impressed the teachers.
meanings.sent2: The precocity of the flowers blooming in spring brought joy to all.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's precocity in catching mice was both helpful and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The precocity of the new technology surpassed all expectations.
meanings.sent5: The precocity of the athlete's skills made them a standout in the competition.
